description: Numbers n dividing P(n)!, where P(n) is the largest prime factor of n.
comments: Solutions to Diophantine equation P(n)=K(n), where P(n) is the largest prime which divides n and K(n) is the Kempner function A002034.
references: P. Erd≈ës, C. Ashbacher, Thoughts of Pal Erdos on Some Smarandache Notions, Smarandache Notions Journal, Vol. 8, No. 1-2-3, 1997, 220-224.
formula: a(n) ~ n. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 20 2012
prog: (PARI) is(n)=my(s=factor(n)[, 1]); s[#s]!%n==0 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 20 2012
author: Charles T. Le (charlestle(AT)yahoo.com)
extensions: Corrected and extended by _Naohiro Nomoto_, Jul 14 2001
